intro: Machaerina planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaf machaerina, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture with a distinctive flat or broad shape. Machaerina planifolia is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
